verses.verse: My son, do not forget My law, but let your heart guard My commands,
for they shall add length of days and years of life and peace to you.
Mercy and truth will not forsake you; tie them on your neck; write them on the tablet of your heart;
and you shall find favor and good understanding in the sight of God and man.
Trust in Jehovah with all your heart, and lean not to your own understanding;
in all your ways acknowledge Him, and He shall direct your paths.
Do not be wise in your own eyes; fear Jehovah and turn from evil.
Healing shall be to your navel and marrow to your bones.
Honor Jehovah with your substance, and with the firstfruits of all your increase,
and your storerooms shall be filled with plenty, and your wine-vats shall burst with new wine.
My son, do not reject the chastening of Jehovah, and do not loathe His chastisement;
for whom Jehovah loves He corrects, even as a father corrects the son with whom he is pleased.
Happy is the man who finds wisdom, and the man who gets understanding.
For better is its profit than the gain of silver, and its produce more than fine gold;
she is more precious than jewels, and all the things you can desire are not to be compared with her.
Length of days is in her right hand; riches and honor in her left hand.
Her ways are ways of pleasantness, and all her paths peace.
She is a tree of life to the ones who lay hold on her, and blessed are the ones holding her fast.
Jehovah founded the earth by wisdom; He founded the heavens by understanding;
the depths were broken up by His knowledge, and the clouds dropped down the dew.
My son, do not let them depart from your eyes; keep sound wisdom and judgment,
and they shall be life to your soul, and grace to your neck;
then you shall walk in your way safely, and your foot shall not stumble.
When you lie down, you shall not dread; yea, you shall lie down and your sleep shall be sweet.
Do not be afraid of sudden dread, and of the ruin of the wicked ones when it comes.
For Jehovah shall be at your loins, and He shall keep your foot from capture.
Do not withhold good from its owners, when it is in the power of your hand to do it.
Do not say to your neighbor, Go and return, or, Tomorrow I will give, when it is with you.
Do not plot evil against your neighbor, and he lives securely by you.
Do not strive with a man without cause, if he has dealt you no evil.
Do not be envious of the man of violence, and choose not among all his ways.
For one being devious is a disgusting thing to Jehovah, but His counsel is with the upright ones.
The curse of Jehovah is in the house of the wicked one, but He blesses the abode of the righteous ones.
If He will scorn at those scorning, yet He will give grace to the humble one.
The wise ones inherit honor, but fools exalt shame.
